title: Sebastian Shakespeare for the Daily Mail
text: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Jeremy Clarkson and his chums (left) have made millions through the success of motoring TV shows Top Gear and The Grand Tour. But they are in danger of losing much of it with their social network for petrolheads, DriveTribe (inset). I can disclose that the company behind it, Digital Tribe Holdings - which Clarkson set up with his co-hosts Richard 'The Hamster' Hammond and James May, along with their producer Andy Wilman - lost a staggering £6.7 million last year. It comes after losses of £8.3 million in 2017 and £4.2 million in 2016. Earlier this year, the presenters mortgaged their business to Elisabeth Murdoch (right), daughter of media mogul Rupert, for only £5 million. ...read
